childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 small onion, finely chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 medium-sized tomato, diced
  • 1/4 cup cooked meat (such as ground pork, diced ham, or shredded chicken), optional
  • Salt and pepper, to taste
  • Cooking oil for frying

Instructions:

  1. In a bowl, crack the eggs and beat them until well combined. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.

  2. Heat a small amount of oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Sauté the minced garlic until fragrant and slightly golden.

  3. Add the chopped onion to the pan and sauté until it becomes translucent.

  4. If using cooked meat, add it to the pan and stir-fry for a minute to heat it through.

  5. Add the diced tomatoes to the pan and cook for another minute until they soften slightly.

  6. Pour the beaten eggs into the pan with the sautéed mixture. Gently swirl the pan to distribute the eggs evenly.

  7. Allow the omelette to cook undisturbed for a few minutes until the bottom sets and the edges start to firm up.

  8. Once the bottom is cooked and the top is still slightly runny, carefully flip the omelette using a spatula or by sliding it onto a plate and inverting it back into the pan. Cook for another minute to ensure both sides are fully cooked.

  9. Slide the cooked omelette onto a serving plate. Cut it into slices and serve hot.

Filipino-style omelette or Torta is a versatile dish that you can customize to your liking by adding different fillings such as cooked meat, vegetables, or cheese. It is commonly enjoyed for breakfast or as a quick and satisfying meal any time of the day.
